</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Animates a door on a vehicle. Animation is defined in config file in [[CfgVehicles]] -> [[Model_Config#AnimationSources| AnimationSources]]. Wanted animation phase is set with phase param. This command works only on animation sources with "door" controller. Door_L in the example below can be animated with [[animateDoor]] but not CargoRamp_Open: <tt>heli [[animateDoor]] ["Door_L", 1];</tt><br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Important </title><part><name index="1"/><value> [[animateDoor]] <tt>phase</tt> param will be rounded: anything >0.5 will be rounded to 1 and <<template><title>=</title></template>0.5 will be rounded to 0. Therefore it is not possible to open a door half way with this command</value></part></template>  <br>
<ext><name>syntaxhighlight</name><attr> lang="cpp"</attr><inner>
class AnimationSources
{
	class CargoRamp_Open
	{
		source = "user";
		animPeriod = 5;
		initPhase = 0;
	};
	class Door_L
	{
		source = "door";
		animPeriod = 1.6;
	};
};</inner><close></syntaxhighlight></close></ext>
To animate doors or other sources that have "user" controller, use [[animate]] command, or even better, [[animateSource]] (recommended). Sources with "hit" controller can be animated with [[setHitPointDamage]] command applied to the name contained in hitpoint property. For availability of animation sources and their controller types see: [[createVehicle/vehicles]]</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object '''animateDoor''' [doorname, phase, instant] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>
